alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico; Worcester (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN SOMERSET...SOUTHWESTERN WICOMICO AND WEST CENTRAL WORCESTER COUNTIES... At 601 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Princess Anne, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. This severe storm will be near... Princess Anne and University Of Maryland Eastern Shore around 620 PM EDT. Westover around 625 PM EDT. West Pocomoke around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Green Hill, Catchpenny, Wetipquin, Oriole, Trinity, Cokesbury, Royal Oak, Eden, Allen and Whitehaven. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
